author: Ira Iosebashvili
title: Dollar Strengthens Against Euro as ECB Frets Over Regionâ€™s Slowing Economy
text:
The dollar rose against the euro Thursday, after dovish comments from the European Central Bank regarding its next steps for its bond-buying program sent the single currency lower.
The euro was recently down 0.4% at $1.2109, its lowest level against the dollar since January. The WSJ Dollar Index, which measures the U.S. currency against a basket of 16 others, was up 0.5% at 85.45.
